ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version

about.summary: Contains routines for logspline density estimation. The function oldlogspline() uses the same algorithm as the logspline package version 1.0.x; i.e. the Kooperberg and Stone (1992)  algorithm (with an improved interface).  The recommended routine logspline() uses an algorithm from Stone et al (1997)  <DOI:10.1214/aos/1031594728>.

Contains routines for logspline density estimation. The function oldlogspline() uses the same algorithm as the logspline package version 1.0.x; i.e. the Kooperberg and Stone (1992)  algorithm (with an improved interface).  The recommended routine logspline() uses an algorithm from Stone et al (1997)  <DOI:10.1214/aos/1031594728>.

name: r-logspline

about.summary: Contains routines for logspline density estimation. The function oldlogspline() uses the same algorithm as the logspline package version 1.0.x; i.e. the Kooperberg and Stone (1992)  algorithm (with an improved interface).  The recommended routine logspline() uses an algorithm from Stone et al (1997)  <DOI:10.1214/aos/1031594728>.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.1.22" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-logspline
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/logspline_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/logspline/logspline_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 773af7a2f12bce0eac30a036bd61bafd9a2b0eb083e377f4ef4e5518a463ed02

build:
  number: 2
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_fortran') }}  # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('logspline')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('logspline')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=logspline
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Contains routines for logspline density estimation. The function oldlogspline() uses the same algorithm as the logspline package version 1.0.x; i.e. the Kooperberg and Stone (1992)  algorithm (with an improved interface).  The recommended routine logspline() uses an algorithm from Stone et al (1997)  <DOI:10.1214/aos/1031594728>.
  license_family: APACHE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: logspline
# Version: 2.1.13
# Date: 2019-06-13
# Title: Routines for Logspline Density Estimation
# Author: Charles Kooperberg <clk@fredhutch.org>
# Maintainer: Charles Kooperberg <clk@fredhutch.org>
# Description: Contains routines for logspline density estimation. The function oldlogspline() uses the same algorithm as the logspline package version 1.0.x; i.e. the Kooperberg and Stone (1992)  algorithm (with an improved interface).  The recommended routine logspline() uses an algorithm from Stone et al (1997)  <DOI:10.1214/aos/1031594728>.
# Imports: stats, graphics
# License: Apache License 2.0
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# Packaged: 2019-06-13 18:13:45 UTC; clk
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-06-13 22:30:04 UTC

about.summary: Contains routines for logspline density estimation. The function oldlogspline() uses the same algorithm as the logspline package version 1.0.x; i.e. the Kooperberg and Stone (1992)  algorithm (with an improved interface).  The recommended routine logspline() uses an algorithm from Stone et al (1997)  <DOI:10.1214/aos/1031594728>.
